intro: Hieracium curtifrons, commonly known as the short-fruited hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium curtifrons is often found in open habitats and can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain areas.
